name: Henri de Lubac

locations.description: Jesuit priest, cardinal, influential theologian and peritus at Vatican II

summary: Henri de Lubac was a French Jesuit priest and cardinal who became one of the most influential theologians of the 20th century. He was a leading figure in the nouvelle th√©ologie movement and served as a peritus at the Second Vatican Council. He made important contributions to ecclesiology, especially regarding the relationship between nature and grace.
keyQuotes: The Church is not an institution that we have been invited to run. We are simply the guests at the table, the servants of the mystery.
The mystery of the Church is the mystery of the Incarnation continued.

writings.title: Catholicism: Christ and the Common Destiny of Man
